hero.headline: When an incident happens, prove what was declared — before memories rewrite it.
hero.subheadline: Horizon is a neutral, append-only infrastructure that seals security and crisis facts as they are declared, without deciding, approving, or interfering with response operations.

bullets.b1: Capture facts during real incidents, not after
bullets.b3: No workflow, no approval, no operational friction

problem.title: Incidents don’t fail in real time. They fail after.

questions.q2: What was declared — and by whom?
questions.q3: Which decisions were taken under pressure?

problem.reconstruction: At that point, reality is reconstructed from emails, chat logs, partial system traces, and human memory.

positioning.title: Horizon is not an incident response tool.
positioning.witness: It acts as a technical witness.
positioning.what_it_does_intro: When a fact is declared during an incident, Horizon:

what_it_does.w3: links it cryptographically to the rest of the incident record.

how.title: How Horizon captures reality during a crisis

step1.title: Facts are declared where they already happen
step1.footer: No new workflow. No operational dependency.

step2.title: Horizon seals, it does not judge

bullets.b2: stores the payload as opaque data,
bullets.b3: chains it immutably to the previous fact.

step2.footer: Horizon does not interpret severity, legitimacy, or correctness.

step3.title: Facts form an append-only Facts Stream
step3.note: An execution may be sealed before an approval. That is not a bug — it is evidence.

post_incident.title: Built for post-incident scrutiny.
post_incident.intro: After an incident, Horizon allows you to show:

bullets.b3: when Horizon received proof of it,
bullets.b5: and which evaluations were later declared.

post_incident.footer: Without log interpretation. Without narrative reconstruction.

evaluations.title: Separate facts from evaluations.
evaluations.intro: A fact can be declared as an evaluation of another fact:
evaluations.horizon: Horizon seals the evaluation, links it to the evaluated fact, and does not interpret the meaning.
evaluations.footer: This preserves audit structure without turning Horizon into a judge.

why.title: Why CISOs use Horizon

bullets.b2: Reality is judged after the fact
bullets.b3: Personal and organizational exposure is real

why.footer: Horizon provides independent evidence, not explanations.

not.title: What Horizon is not
not.footer: Horizon complements them by recording what they cannot guarantee.

signature.one_liner: Horizon provides indisputable evidence of what was declared during a security incident, by whom, and when it was sealed.
signature.short: The system of record for incident facts.
